data.Name: CARBON
data.Subtitle: Unrefined Organic Element
data.Description:
The building block of all organic life. Of critical importance to space travellers, as Carbon is used to <FUEL>recharge mining equipment<>.
 
The <TECHNOLOGY>Mining Laser<> will harvest Carbon from trees, plants, and all other forms of vegetable.

data.Name: CONDENSED CARBON
data.Subtitle: Refined Organic Element
data.Description:
Advanced material, processed from regular <FUEL>carbon<> in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<>.

The increased molecule density offers a substantially improved energy-per-gram ratio.

Occasionally found in crystalline form. Harvesting large crystals may require a <TECHNOLOGY>Advanced Mining Laser<>.

data.Name: OXYGEN
data.Subtitle: Concentrated Liquid Fuel
data.Description:
Integral to the atmospheric filtering technology at the heart of the exosuit <FUEL>life support system<>.

Exosuit material processing allows oxygen to be harvested directly from appropriate planetary flora.

Other plantlife may be scanned with the <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<> to reveal alternative oxygen supplies.

data.Name: DI-HYDROGEN
data.Subtitle: High Energy Substance
data.Description:
A stable, crystalline form of hydrogen remarkable both for its extreme energy density and its stability at atmospheric pressures.

Common to all worlds, Di-hydrogen is found in the form of large <TECHNOLOGY>blue crystals<>. It is a key component of <COMMODITY>Starship Launch Fuel<>.

data.Name: DEUTERIUM
data.Subtitle: High Energy Substance
data.Description:
A stable hydrogen isotope used heavily in both small-scale fusion reactors and neutron-scattering shield technology.

Deuterium very rarely occurs naturally. Most of the galaxy's supply comes from the processing of <TECHNOLOGY>Di-hydrogen<> in <TECHNOLOGY>Refiners<>.

data.Name: TRITIUM
data.Subtitle: Neutron-Rich Fuel Element
data.Description:
Radioactive isotope commonly used to fuel the fusion reactor at the heart of starship <TECHNOLOGY>Pulse Engines<>.

Abundant in interstellar asteroid fields, Tritium can be <COMMODITY>mined from asteroids<> using starship weaponry.

data.Name: FERRITE DUST
data.Subtitle: Metallic Mineral Extract
data.Description:
An abundant mineral element, found in <EARTH>rock formations<> and other areas of geological interest. Easily extracted using a <TECHNOLOGY>Mining Laser<>.

Typically requires processing in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> before use in construction or technology manufacture.

data.Name: PURE FERRITE
data.Subtitle: Processed Metallic Minerals
data.Description:
Processed metal, free of dust and pebbles. Used to construct a wide variety of <EARTH>structures<> and <TECHNOLOGY>technologies<>.

Typically purified from Ferrite dust using a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<>, but can occasionally be found in large deposits. Collection may require an <TECHNOLOGY>Advanced Mining Laser<>.

data.Name: MAGNETISED FERRITE
data.Subtitle: Charged Metallic Element
data.Description:
Highly processed metal, requiring several stages of processing in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<>.

Used in the creation of advanced structures and technologies. Avoid ingestion.

data.Name: SODIUM
data.Subtitle: Unrefined Catalytic Element
data.Description:
A powerful <CATALYST>catalyst<>, useful for charging <COMMODITY>defensive technologies<> such as shields or hazard protection.
 
Exosuit material handling technology allows automatic harvesting from appropriate <CATALYST<>sodium-rich flora<>.

A vital ingredient in the creation of many advanced devices, products and components.

data.Name: SODIUM NITRATE
data.Subtitle: Refined Catalytic Element
data.Description:
An <CATALYST>advanced catalyst<>, useful for charging <COMMODITY>defensive technologies<> such as shields or hazard protection.
 
Created in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<>, or occasionally found in crystalline form on a planet's surface.

Offers a substantially improved energy-per-gram ratio over regular Sodium.

data.Name: COBALT
data.Subtitle: Subterranean Mineral
data.Description:
Mined from <TECHNOLOGY>underground minerals<>, cobalt is found in plentiful supply in caves and caverns. Useful in the manufacture of <COMMODITY>Ion Batteries<>.

It is used in the creation of several technologies and structures, and can be processed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to make the most of its inherent charge.

data.Name: IONISED COBALT
data.Subtitle: Processed Subterranean Mineral
data.Description:
A highly energised form of <TECHNOLOGY>Cobalt<>, this processed metal can be used to create <COMMODITY>Advanced Ion Batteries<>, a conveniently portable source of energy for the <TECHNOLOGY>Exosuit<>.

In widespread use as a key component in the creation of <TECHNOLOGY>advanced technologies and structures<>.

data.Name: SALT
data.Subtitle: Aquatic Mineral Extract
data.Description:
A naturally occuring salt, found in abundance in <TECHNOLOGY>underwater minerals<>.

Can be processed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create <TRADEABLE>Chlorine<>. This refined form is used in the manufacture of advanced products and technologies.

data.Name: CHLORINE
data.Subtitle: Processed Aquatic Mineral
data.Description:
A reactive element most easily harvested by processing the salt-infused minerals found in <TECHNOLOGY>oceans<>.

Used in the manufacture of advanced technologies.

data.Name: COPPER
data.Subtitle: Refined Stellar Metal: Yellow
data.Description:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets.

Copper is found on planets orbiting <CATALYST>yellow stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<> for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.

data.Name: CADMIUM
data.Subtitle: Refined Stellar Metal: Red
data.Description:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets.

Cadmium is found on planets orbiting <FUEL>red stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<> for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.

data.Name: EMERIL
data.Subtitle: Refined Stellar Metal: Green
data.Description:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

Emeril is found on planets orbiting <TRADEABLE>green stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<> for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.

data.Name: INDIUM
data.Subtitle: Refined Stellar Metal: Blue
data.Description:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets.

Indium is found on planets orbiting <TECHNOLOGY>blue stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<> for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.

data.Name: CHROMATIC METAL
data.Subtitle: Highly Refined Stellar Metal
data.Description:
A processed metal alloy, created in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> from the <STELLAR>stellar metals<>: <COMMODITY>Copper<>, <FUEL>Cadmium<>, <TRADEABLE>Emeril<> and <TECHNOLOGY>Indium<>.

The <SPECIAL>rarer<> the stellar metal, the more Chromatic Metal it will produce.

This valuable metal is used in the creation of many <TECHNOLOGY>advanced technologies<>.

data.Name: NANITE CLUSTER
data.Subtitle: Technological Currency
data.Description:
A dense miasma of <TECHNOLOGY>Nanites<>, undulating in its potentiality. These clusters are stable, but unrestricted nanite foam can produce undesirable runaway reactions in the presence of organic matter.

Used in the construction of advanced technologies. Highly valuable to specialist traders.

data.Name: PARAFFINIUM
data.Subtitle: Localised Earth Element
data.Description:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on planets with a <TRADEABLE>tropical environment<>.

data.Name: PYRITE
data.Subtitle: Localised Earth Element
data.Description:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on planets with a <FUEL>desert environment<>.

data.Name: AMMONIA
data.Subtitle: Localised Earth Element
data.Description:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on planets with a <TRADEABLE>toxic environment<>.

data.Name: URANIUM
data.Subtitle: Localised Earth Element
data.Description:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on planets with a <CATALYST>radioactive environment<>.

data.Name: DIOXITE
data.Subtitle: Localised Earth Element
data.Description:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on planets with a <TECHNOLOGY>frozen environment<>.

data.Name: PHOSPHORUS
data.Subtitle: Localised Earth Element
data.Description:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an <TECHNOLOGY>Analysis Visor<>.

Typically found on planets with a <FUEL>scorched environment<>.

data.Name: MORDITE
data.Subtitle: Harvested Substance
data.Description:
Despite much study, little is known about this haunting, crystalline compound.

It is released from the cadavers of dying creatures, but can also be specifically <TRADEABLE>cultivated<> and harvested from the <SPECIAL>Mordite Root<> plant.

data.Name: PUGNEUM
data.Subtitle: Anomalous Material
data.Description:
This oily, unsettling liquid leaks from the circuitry of <SPECIAL>Sentinels<>.

Prized by the <FUEL>Vy'keen<>, Pugneum is thought to share some essential properties with <TECHNOLOGY>Nanites<>. It hums in a sinister fashion upon contact with organic matter.

data.Name: SILVER
data.Subtitle: Valuable Asteroid Mineral
data.Description:
Valuable interstellar trading mineral, typically <COMMODITY>mined from asteroids<>. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits.

Prized by people in all systems for its lustre and shine.

data.Name: GOLD
data.Subtitle: Valuable Asteroid Mineral
data.Description:
Highly valuable interstellar trading mineral, typically <COMMODITY>mined from asteroids<>. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits.

Universally prized for its beauty and versatility.

data.Name: PLATINUM
data.Subtitle: Valuable Asteroid Mineral
data.Description:
Extremely valuable interstellar trading mineral, typically <COMMODITY>mined from asteroids<>. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits.

Universally prized for its hardiness and versatility.

data.Name: SULPHURINE
data.Subtitle: Compressed Atmospheric Gas
data.Description:
A pungent atmospheric <TRADEABLE>gas<>. High concentrations are extremely hazardous to organic life.

With the aid of <TECHNOLOGY>specialised machinery<>, can be extracted from the atmospheres of <FUEL>Scorched<> and <SPECIAL>Desert<> planets.

data.Name: RADON
data.Subtitle: Compressed Atmospheric Gas
data.Description:
A colourless, odourless <TRADEABLE>gas<> with a relatively short half-life. 

Found in both <COMMODITY>Radioactive<> and <TECHNOLOGY>Frozen<> atmospheres, this gas is produced by the decay of other high-energy elements.

data.Name: NITROGEN
data.Subtitle: Compressed Atmospheric Gas
data.Description:
A reactive atmospheric <TRADEABLE>gas<> found wherever there is organic life.

Nitrogen is readily harvested from the atmospheres of <TRADEABLE>Lush<> and <TRADEABLE>Toxic<> planets.

data.Name: ACTIVATED COPPER
data.Subtitle: Refined Stellar Metal: Yellow
data.Description:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

This Copper has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable.

Copper is found on planets orbiting <CATALYST>yellow stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<>.

data.Name: ACTIVATED CADMIUM
data.Subtitle: Refined Stellar Metal: Red
data.Description:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

This Cadmium has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable.

Cadmium is found on planets orbiting <FUEL>red stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<>.

data.Name: ACTIVATED EMERIL
data.Subtitle: Refined Stellar Metal: Green
data.Description:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

This Emeril has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable.

Emeril is found on planets orbiting <TRADEABLE>green stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<>.

data.Name: ACTIVATED INDIUM
data.Subtitle: Refined Stellar Metal: Blue
data.Description:
A <STELLAR>chromatic metal<>, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

Indium is found on planets orbiting <TECHNOLOGY>blue stars<>, and can be placed in a <TECHNOLOGY>Refiner<> to create purified <STELLAR>Chromatic Metal<>.

This Indium has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable.

data.Name: FUNGAL MOULD
data.Subtitle: Harvested Agricultural Substance
data.Description:
An oddly-glowing substance, harvested from the gills of <TRADEABLE>Fungal Clusters<>.

The host plant requires a <TRADEABLE>toxic climate<> to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a <TECHNOLOGY>Hydroponics Tray<>.

data.Name: FROST CRYSTAL
data.Subtitle: Harvested Agricultural Substance
data.Description:
A beautiful blue crystal, this organic compound possesses both great hardiness and a shimmering translucence. It is harvested from the leaves of <TRADEABLE>Frostwort<>.

Frostwort requires <TECHNOLOGY>frozen conditions<> to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a <TECHNOLOGY>Hydroponics Tray<>.

data.Name: GAMMA ROOT
data.Subtitle: Harvested Agricultural Substance
data.Description:
A strange substance that seems to slowly shift the air around it. It is found in the roots of the <TRADEABLE>Gamma Weed plant<>.

Gamma Weed requires <COMMODITY>high background radiation<> to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a <TECHNOLOGY>Hydroponics Tray<>.

data.Name: CACTUS FLESH
data.Subtitle: Harvested Agricultural Substance
data.Description:
Succulent, edible cactus flesh from the <TRADEABLE>Echinocactus plant<>. As well as being juicy on the tongue, the flesh has many industrial uses.

The Echinocactus thrives only on <FUEL>desert planets<>, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a <TECHNOLOGY>Hydroponics Tray<>..

data.Name: SOLANIUM
data.Subtitle: Harvested Agricultural Substance
data.Description:
A powerful chemical that has resisted attempts at synthesis. It can be harvested from the bark of the <TRADEABLE>Solar Vine<>.

The vine requires a <FUEL>hot climate<> to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a <TECHNOLOGY>Hydroponics Tray<>.

data.Name: STAR BULB
data.Subtitle: Harvested Agricultural Substance
data.Description:
A beautiful gemstone, this prized product is the engorged, luminescent berry of the <TRADEABLE>Star Bramble<>.

The host plant requires <TRADEABLE>lush conditions<> to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a <TECHNOLOGY>Hydroponics Tray<>.

data.Name: MARROW BULB
data.Subtitle: Harvested Agricultural Substance
data.Description:
A glowing organic bulb, harvested from the <TRADEABLE>Cave Marrow plant<> found growing <TECHNOLOGY>underground<>.

The Cave Marrow has proved resistant to domestication, and no farmable cultivars are known to exist. As such, marrow bulbs must be harvested by hand in the wild.

data.Name: KELP SAC
data.Subtitle: Harvested Agricultural Substance
data.Description:
A rubbery, luminescent sac harvested from <TECHNOLOGY>underwater<> <TRADEABLE>Candle Kelp<> plants.

Agricultural science has not yet tamed the Candle Kelp. As such, these sacs cannot be farmed.

data.Name: COPRITE
data.Subtitle: Harvested Agricultural Substance
data.Description:
A foul-smelling compound that can be harvested from the <TRADEABLE>Coprite Flower<>, or less desirably from the faecal matter of some species.

Creatures can be fed to encourage the formation and deposition of coprite crystals.

data.Name: RESIDUAL GOOP
data.Subtitle: Junk
data.Description:
A pulsating, foul smelling goop that builds up in poorly-maintained machinery.

Skin contact is not advised.

data.Name: RUNAWAY MOULD
data.Subtitle: Junk
data.Description:
An out of control mould growth that builds up in poorly-maintained machinery.

Likely to be several different species of mould, merged together into one super-colony.

data.Name: RUSTED METAL
data.Subtitle: Junk
data.Description:
Handfuls of corroded metal, the result of years of poor maintenance.

Handle with care.

data.Name: LIVING SLIME
data.Subtitle: Junk
data.Description:
A heavy, oozing slime. It is moving gently, as if it has a heartbeat of its own.

Nutrient source: <FUEL>unknown<>.

data.Name: VISCOUS FLUIDS
data.Subtitle: Junk
data.Description:
An unnaturally thick liquid of dubious colour. Its origins are impossible to fathom.

Appears to have some mild magnetic properties.
